summary:
"The Thinker" is a famous bronze statue by artist Auguste Rodin. It shows a large, naked man sitting on a rock, with his chin resting on his hand, deep in thought. This powerful image is often linked to philosophy.

Rodin first designed it for a larger artwork called "The Gates of Hell" in 1880. However, the first big bronze version was made in 1904 and is now in Paris. There are 27 full-sized copies, with many smaller versions and studies.
title: The Thinker
